text: Which HF bands have segments exclusively allocated to Amateur Extra licensees?
choices: All HF bands except 160 meters and 10 meters

text: What is the power limit for beacon stations?
What is the limit for transmitter power on the 28 MHz band for a General Class control operator?
Until an upgrade to General class is shown in the FCC database, when must a Technician licensee identify with ΓÇ£AGΓÇ¥ after their call sign?
choices: Whenever they operate using General class frequency privileges
Whenever they operate on any amateur frequency
Whenever they operate using Technician frequency privileges
A special identifier is not required if their General class license application has been filed with the FCC

text: Which of the following conditions require a licensed amateur radio operator to take specific steps to avoid harmful interference to other users or facilities?
choices: When operating within one mile of an FCC Monitoring Station
When using a band where the Amateur Service is secondary
When a station is transmitting spread spectrum emissions

text: Which of the following statements is true of VOX operation versus PTT operation?
choices: The received signal is more natural sounding

text: Which of the following is good amateur practice for net management?
choices: Always use multiple sets of phonetics during check-in
Have a backup frequency in case of interference or poor conditions
Transmit the full net roster at the beginning of every session

text: What does the Q signal ΓÇ£QRNΓÇ¥ mean?
What is the Volunteer Monitor Program?
choices: Amateur volunteers who are formally enlisted to monitor the airwaves for rules violations
Amateur volunteers who conduct amateur licensing examinations
Amateur volunteers who conduct frequency coordination for amateur VHF repeaters
Amateur volunteers who use their station equipment to help civil defense organizations in times of emergency

text: Which of the following is a common location for FT8?
choices: Anywhere in the voice portion of the band
Anywhere in the CW portion of the band

text: How can a geomagnetic storm affect HF propagation?
Which of the following is a way to determine current propagation on a desired band from your station?
choices: Use a network of automated receiving stations on the internet to see where your transmissions are being received
Send a series of dots and listen for echoes

text: Which ionospheric region is the most absorbent of signals below 10 MHz during daylight hours?
What is the purpose of an antenna tuner?
choices: Reduce the SWR in the feed line to the antenna
Reduce the power dissipation in the feedline to the antenna
Increase power transfer from the transmitter to the feed line

text: When is an analog multimeter preferred to a digital multimeter?
choices: When measuring the frequency of an oscillator
When adjusting circuits for maximum or minimum values

text: Which of the following might be useful in reducing RF interference to audio frequency circuits?
How close to the lower edge of a bandΓÇÖs phone segment should your displayed carrier frequency be when using 3 kHz wide LSB?
choices: At least 3 kHz above the edge of the segment
At least 3 kHz below the edge of the segment
At least 1 kHz below the edge of the segment
At least 1 kHz above the edge of the segment

text: What is the approximate open-circuit voltage from a fully illuminated silicon photovoltaic cell?
Which of the following is opposition to the flow of alternating current in a capacitor?
What dB change represents a factor of two increase or decrease in power?
Which of the following components should be added to a capacitor to increase the capacitance?
What is the approximate forward threshold voltage of a silicon junction diode?
Which of the following is an advantage of CMOS integrated circuits compared to TTL integrated circuits?
choices: Better suited for power supply regulation

text: What is characteristic of a half-wave rectifier in a power supply?
choices: The ripple frequency is twice that of a full-wave rectifier
More current can be drawn from the half-wave rectifier
The output voltage is two times the peak input voltage

text: How is the efficiency of an RF power amplifier determined?
choices: Divide the DC input power by the DC output power
Divide the RF output power by the DC input power
Multiply the RF input power by the reciprocal of the RF output power
Add the RF input power to the DC output power

text: What term specifies a filterΓÇÖs attenuation inside its passband?
What is link margin?
choices: The difference between received power level and minimum required signal level at the input to the receiver

text: What is the relationship between transmitted symbol rate and bandwidth?
choices: Symbol rate and bandwidth are not related
Higher symbol rates require wider bandwidth
Lower symbol rates require wider bandwidth
Bandwidth is half the symbol rate

text: Which of the following narrow-band digital modes can receive signals with very low signal-to-noise ratios?
Which of the following factors determine the characteristic impedance of a parallel conductor feed line?
choices: The distance between the centers of the conductors and the radius of the conductors
The distance between the centers of the conductors and the length of the line
The radius of the conductors and the frequency of the signal
The frequency of the signal and the length of the line

text: What is the approximate length for a 1/2 wave dipole antenna cut for 3.550 MHz?
How do the lengths of a three-element Yagi reflector and director compare to that of the driven element?
choices: The reflector is longer, and the director is shorter
The reflector is shorter, and the director is longer
They are all the same length
Relative length depends on the frequency of operation

text: What is an advantage of vertically stacking horizontally polarized Yagi antennas?
choices: It allows quick selection of vertical or horizontal polarization
It allows simultaneous vertical and horizontal polarization
It narrows the main lobe in azimuth
It narrows the main lobe in elevation

text: How can you determine that your station complies with FCC RF exposure regulations?
choices: By calculation based on FCC OET Bulletin 65
By calculation based on computer modeling
By measurement of field strength using calibrated equipment

text: What is the purpose of a power supply interlock?
choices: To prevent unauthorized changes to the circuit that would void the manufacturerΓÇÖs warranty
To shut down the unit if it becomes too hot
To ensure that dangerous voltages are removed if the cabinet is opened
To shut off the power supply if too much voltage is produced
